title: Essays in Applied Microeconomics of Development, Doctoral Thesis
author: Plamen Nicolov
description: I did a close read and developmental edit of two chapters of Plamen's doctoral thesis: "Does HIV Therapy Stimulate Risky Sexual Behavior? A Field Experiment in South Africa" and "One Step at a Time: Does Gradualism Foster Group Coordination?". Plamen received his degree in 2013.

title: Emergency Management for Sport and Physical Activity
author: Casa and Stearns
description: I copyedited the full manuscript of this first edition health textbook written by Douglas Casa and Rebecca Stearns.

title: Nurse Practitionerâ€™s Business and Legal Guide, Fifth Edition and The Pearson Report
author: Caroline Buppert and Linda Pearson
description: I copyedited the full manuscript for the fifth edition of Caroline Buppert's top seller in the professional nursing field. As part of the project, I also edited the renowned Pearson Report by Linda Pearson, which had previously been published by nursing organizations. This was the first time it went through the production process at a mainstream publisher.

title: Security Consulting
author: Charles Sennewald
description: I proofread this 264-page first edition by Charles Sennewald. Sennewald is an independent security consultant with a conversational writing style, and his prose required careful attention during proofreading.

title: Frequently Prescribed Medications: Drugs You Need to Know
author: Michael Mancano and Jason Gallagher
description: I proofread this 382-page second edition medical text, which required extreme attention to detail due to the nature of the content.
